title: Work - force causing constant kinetic energy

content.question: An object moves under the influence of a single force of constant magnitude. The objectâ€™s kinetic energy is constant throughout its motion. Which of the following statements is a correct claim about this force?

choices.label: The directions of the force and velocity are the same as each other.
The directions of the force and velocity are opposite to each other.
The directions of the force and velocity are perpendicular to each other.
The directions of the force and velocity are neither parallel nor perpendicular to each other.

content.answer: The directions of the force and velocity are perpendicular to each other.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
